name: Nurture Hydrating Shampoo For Dry Hair
about: What it is:A moisturizing shampoo that leaves dry hair feeling softer, silkier, and more deeply hydrated without weighing it down..Hair Type:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Texture:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Concerns:- Dryness.Key Benefits:- Instantly hydrates dry hair.Highlighted Ingredients:- Aloe Leaf Juice: Known to attract moisture from the environment to hydrate hair..Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:Instantly smooth frizz, add shine, and moisturize dry hair with a silicone-free shampoo that hydrates without weight. Lab proven to provide decadent hydration for silkier strands, thanks to aloe leaf juice and amino acids, your hair will look and feel luxuriantly soft and healthy after every rinse..Fragrance Description:An accord of amber woods and musk brings luminous warmth to a blend of balmy summer flowers, rounded by touches of crisp apple and violet leaf..Clinical Results:Based on a 21-day consumer study of 35 subjects used daily:
ingredients: -Aloe Leaf Juice: Known to attract moisture from the environment to hydrate hair..-Panthenol: Vitamin B5 helps fortify hair to restore shine and luster..-Camellia Seed Oil: A source of antioxidants and essential fatty acids that aid moisture and shine...Water/Aqua/Eau, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Sodium Methyl Cocoyl Taurate, Cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine, Lauryl Glucoside, Glyceryl Stearate SE, Coco-Glucoside, Hydrogenated Farnesene*, Squalane, Glycerin, Panthenol, Pyrus Malus (Apple) Fruit Extract, Glyceryl Oleate, Sorbitan Oleate Decylglucoside Crosspolymer, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Citrus Reticulata (Tangerine) Peel Oil, Sodium Gluconate, Sodium Levulinate, Sodium Chloride, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Fragrance/Parfum, Hexyl Cinnamal, Limonene, Linalool..*Sugarcane Derived Hemisqualane..The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply to wet hair and gently massage into scalp with the pads of your fingers, adding more if needed to make sure your entire scalp gets all lathered up. .-Rinse. .-Follow up with your favorite JVN conditioner... Recycling Instructions:.-Please refer to your local recycling center for guidance on how to recycle.                                                                                                                                                                                        -Aluminum bottle: 100 percent infinitely recyclable..-Pump: Post-consumer-recycled..-Outer packaging: FSC-certified with soy-based ink.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is NOT a hydrating shampoo. I used this on my Type 4 hair yesterday, thinking this would give me hydration. So I tried the a section in the back to see if my hair would respond better to the 2nd wash. It drieddd my hair out. This should be renamed to clarifying shampoo. I ended up using another shampoo for my 2nd wash which saved my hair. I also felt like with that 1st wash, I was losing unnecessary hair. Never again. Returning this week. This is not for all hair types. Definitely not for Type 4 hair which needs the moisture.  I also feel like most of the reviews are not honest so trust this review which is new to this brand and paid for with my own money.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful but the scent is my only issue.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: To Jonathan, JVN and whoever's reading: This shampoo is beautiful. I've been a JVN user since 2021 and i'm glad i made the switch. the leave in is nice, the mask is heavenly and the Nurture line was/is my favorite. But like MANY other reviews (like 90% of them on sephora and the jvn site) WE WANT THE OLD SCENT BACK. You have created such a nice product that saved my hair after years of trail+error with other shampoos and damage. The OG purple had this earthy, vanilla je ne sais quoi about it which is nice for me since im fem, but i like musky scents. The products still work the same (thank u) but NOW, you went mainstream with this, floral hit you in the face fragrance but now it lost its flare. Lasty, most of your buyers are LGBTQ+! most of us don't want all of our products to smell like every other brand and thats what was so special about this line. I will continue to support JVN, but at least bring the purple bottle back as an option so the lovers of the OG can buy it still. Why ruin something so already amazing, keep it amazing but then lessen the value of its amazingness? Consider all of these reviews, helpful for the future of the brand please.
